page.title: 03HAMLET OF WALES-THE 2 WELLS
page.content: In the hamlet of Wales there are two wells, both were believed to have healing properties. People with eye diseases travelled great distances to visit Eyewell believing that the soft water would cure their ailments. A little lower and nearer to the River Cam is Blackwell. This well contains harder more sulpherus water which appeared to cure diseases of the skin. The visitors which these wells brought to the village were welcomed by the villagers eager for money. If river water entered the wells the villagers would bail it out, fearing that their source of income would suffer when the diluted water failed to heal. Nowadays the sites of the wells are kept clear by the villagers so that they can still be visited.
